short_summary: Construction of a new monitoring station at South Saskatchewan River at Medicine Hat. The project is expected to start on March 29th, 2024 and be completed within 15 weeks. This will allow continued production of discharge data
description: The water survey of Canada has two main project objectives in this tenders. The first is to construct a monitoring station in a timely manner allowing continuous production of discharge data. The second is to repair and replace damaged portions of the shelter at the existing monitoring station.

Government Tender Announcement
---

* **Contract Title: ** SOUTH SASKATCHEWAN RIVER AT MEDICINE HAT – 05AJ001 – ALBERTA - MONITORING STATION REBUILD
* **Notice Type: ** Request for Proposal
* **Procurement Category: ** Construction Joint Venture
* **Industry Category: ** Specialty Building and Trades Services

**Project Overview:**
The Water Survey of Canada (WSC) and Environment and Climate Change Canada - National Hydrological Service (ECCC - NHS) require the construction of a monitoring station at the 05AJ001 - South Saskatchewan River at Medicine Hat site. The existing infrastructure is due for an upgrade to maintain continuous production of discharge data and ensure operational safety. A new building is necessary to replace the deteriorated shelter.

**Project Scope:**
The selected contractor will be responsible for:

* The design and construction of a new monitoring station in accordance with applicable guidelines and standards.
* Minimal impact on the environment during construction.
* Completion of the scope of work within 15 weeks.

**Tender Details:**

* **Reference Number:** cb-958-55629697
* **Solicitation Number:** 5000078220
* **Notice Date:** March 4, 2024
* **Tender Closing Date:** March 19, 2024, at 18:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** March 29, 2024
* **Expected Contract End Date:** March 31, 2025

**Evaluation Criteria:**
The selected contractor will be evaluated based on the lowest price.
